snippet: The tech industry is doubling down on efforts to speed up the Web as people refuse to wait even 250 milliseconds for a page to load.
abstract: Tech industry is doubling down on efforts to speed up the Web as people refuse to wait even 250 milliseconds for a page to load; competition to be the quickest search engine is fierce; two-second rule is still often cited as a standard for Web commerce sites, yet experts in human-computer interaction say that rule is outdated.
lead_paragraph: The tech industry is doubling down on efforts to speed up the Web as people refuse to wait even 250 milliseconds for a page to load.

headline.seo: Impatient Web Users Flee Slow-Loading Sites
headline.main: For Impatient Web Users, an Eye Blink Is Just Too Long to Wait
headline.print_headline: For Impatient Web Users, an Eye Blink Is Just Too Long to Wait
